name: ISO/IEC 15444-2:2004. Information technology -- JPEG 2000 image coding system: Extensions (formal name), JPEG 2000 coding extensions (common name)
definition: Compression encoding that employs discrete wavelet transforms and is generally used for full color and grayscale continuous-tone pictorial images, an extension of JP2_C, JPEG 2000 Part 1, Core Coding. J2K_EXT extensions include more flexible wavelet decomposition and quantization, new methods to encode regions of interest (ROIs), and other features.
